title: Google Satellite Maps - Huge Type
content:
Using Google's relatively new [mapping site](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps) and turning on the satellite imagery funtion, people are starting to do 'Google Sightseeing'. Pretty cool.   
   
Why's it relevant to Typophile? There's one guy who has a page dedicated to ' [Large Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/www.shreddies.org/gmaps/category/large-type/)'
author: Chris Rugen

comments.content: [_"What mere mortals see from the ground when people GoogleMap a spot nearby._"](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/kokogiak/8648226/)

That's pretty cool. I couldn't find the Hollywood sign that they posted, so I decided to look for something closer to home:   
   
SOUTH SAN FRANCISCO THE INDUSTRIAL CITY   
 [http://maps.google.com/maps?ll=37.663224935531616,-122.41793990135193&spn=0.00582575798034668,0.008121728897094727&t=k&hl=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps?ll=37.663224935531616%2C-122.41793990135193&spn=0.00582575798034668%2C0.008121728897094727&t=k&hl=en)

Cool stuff.   
   
The Hollywood sign is vertical so it's probably hard to see. But I did find the Hollywood Bowl... No letters though, sorry. Hey, what about crop circles? Those count as alien lettering, right? :-)   
   
hhp

Google maps is second only to Wikipedia as being one of those sites where you go to look something up and then realize you've just spend an hour randomly looking at things.   
   
That's a great blog, Chris!

The Rainbow Bridge in Utah ( [on the front page for now](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/www.shreddies.org/gmaps/)) is another cool view.   
   
I could spend a long time in [Grand Canyon, Arizona](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps?q=grand+canyon+86023&t=k&hl=en), too.

I've spent the last hour trying to find [Roden Crater](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/www.pbs.org/art21/artists/turrell/clip1.html).   
No luck yet.

Hey if you like Google's satellite images, check out Nasa's World Wind [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/worldwind.arc.nasa.gov/). Unfortunately only Windows right now, but they're working on a [Mac version](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/worldwind.arc.nasa.gov/forums/index.php?showtopic=35)...

Trying to find a few that I know of:   
   
I used to always pass this driving, it seems much larger in person than it does from a sattelite, but the "Acura" on the hill to the right of the indicator:   
 [http://maps.google.com/maps?q=29080+marguerite+pkwy,mission+viejo,+ca&spn=0.005525350570678711,0.006791353225708008&t=k&hl=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps?q=29080+marguerite+pkwy%2Cmission+viejo%2C+ca&spn=0.005525350570678711%2C0.006791353225708008&t=k&hl=en)   
   
Shadow of "The Big A" at Anaheim Stadium (and some cool motocross action!):   
 [http://maps.google.com/maps?ll=33.79966378211975,-117.88068294525146&spn=0.005525350570678711,0.006791353225708008&t=k&hl=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps?ll=33.79966378211975%2C-117.88068294525146&spn=0.005525350570678711%2C0.006791353225708008&t=k&hl=en)

The sun is always shining.   
On Georgian Bay, it's a beautiful Fall evening, and the leaves are turning.

Funny!   
   
And you know what's impressive? In a few short years Google has managed to place "ï¿½2005 Google" markers over the entire surface of the earth...   
   
hhp

Directions from Typophile HQ to the best tapas in San Francisco.   
   
 [http://maps.google.com/maps?t=k&saddr=130+bush+street,san+francisco,+ca&daddr=44+Belden+Pl,San+Francisco,+CA+94104&hl=en](http://web.archive.org/web/20070306193740/http:/maps.google.com/maps?t=k&saddr=130+bush+street%2Csan+francisco%2C+ca&daddr=44+Belden+Pl%2CSan+Francisco%2C+CA+94104&hl=en)
